intro: Ouratea crenata, commonly known as the laceleaf ouratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Venezuela. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmately lobed leaves that give it a feathery appearance. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Ouratea crenata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
